questions.question: What is the primary function of a multiplexer (MUX) in digital logic circuits?
options: To store a single bit of data.
To select one of several input signals and forward it to a single output.
To perform arithmetic operations like addition or subtraction.
To generate a clock signal for synchronization.
To convert an analog signal to a digital signal.

questions.question: In a virtual memory system, what is the primary role of a 'page table'?
options: To store recently accessed data for faster retrieval by the CPU.
To translate virtual addresses used by programs into physical addresses in main memory.
To manage the flow of data between the CPU and I/O devices.
To serve as a high-speed cache for instruction fetching.
To determine the execution order of instructions in an out-of-order processor.

questions.question: In digital IC design, what is a 'Clock Domain Crossing (CDC)' primarily concerned with?
options: Ensuring that all flip-flops in a design receive the clock signal at the exact same time.
Synchronizing data transfer between circuit blocks operating with different, asynchronous, or phase-shifted clock signals.
Optimizing the clock network to minimize power consumption.
Detecting and resolving timing violations related to setup and hold times within a single clock domain.
Converting a high-frequency clock signal into a lower-frequency clock signal.

questions.question: Which instruction set architecture (ISA) philosophy relies on the compiler to explicitly package multiple independent operations into a single, wide instruction word for parallel execution by multiple functional units, rather than relying on hardware-based dynamic scheduling?
options: CISC (Complex Instruction Set Computing)
RISC (Reduced Instruction Set Computing)
VLIW (Very Long Instruction Word)
SIMD (Single Instruction, Multiple Data)
MIMD (Multiple Instruction, Multiple Data)

questions.question: In the reliability analysis of integrated circuits, what phenomenon describes the gradual transport of material in metal interconnect lines due to the momentum transfer from conducting electrons, potentially leading to opens or shorts over time?
options: Negative Bias Temperature Instability (NBTI)
Hot Carrier Injection (HCI)
Electromigration (EM)
Dielectric Breakdown (DB)
Thermal Runaway (TR)
